oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BEHAVIOR OF THE BEACHES ON THE NORTH OF SPAIN
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lechuga, Antonio
de la Pe√±a, Jose
Anton, Ana
Diez, Galo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach erosion
climate change
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study is an analysis about morphological problems, due to anthropic or other causes. We carried out the behavior and evolution of ten beaches on the North Coast of Spain, in order to see if climate change was involved. To do this, it was necessary to consider data from Cantabrian sea buoys during fifteen years. Besides we made use of, maps, nautical charts and bathymetric records. We applied a kind of parameters to measure the energy including on each beach, so to be able to compare therm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; sediment.74
